message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including dry skin, intolerance to cold, weight gain, and constipation, are classic signs of hypothyroidism. The high TSH level and low T4 level also support this diagnosis. Among the medications listed, Amiodarone is known to cause hypothyroidism as a side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms are consistent with hypothyroidism, and the TSH level is elevated while T4 and T3 are low. Among the medication options, amiodarone can cause hypothyroidism as a side effect. Digoxin, theophylline, and warfarin do not have a known association with hypothyroidism.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest hypothyroidism, and the elevated TSH and decreased T4 are consistent with this diagnosis. Among the options, Amiodarone is known to cause hypothyroidism as a side effect. Digoxin, Theophylline, and Warfarin do not have this side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of hypothyroidism, as evidenced by the high TSH and low T4 levels. Among the options, Amiodarone can cause hypothyroidism as a side effect. The other medications do not have hypothyroidism as a known side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of hypothyroidism, with high TSH levels and low T4 levels. The most likely cause is amiodarone, which is known to cause thyroid dysfunction. Digoxin, Theophylline, and Warfarin are not associated with thyroid dysfunction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest hypothyroidism, and the TSH level confirms it. Among the medication options given, Amiodarone is known to cause thyroid dysfunction, both hyper- and hypothyroidism.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms are suggestive of hypothyroidism, and the TSH level is elevated with low T4 and normal T3 levels. Among the medications listed, Amiodarone is known to cause hypothyroidism as a side effect, while the other options do not affect thyroid function.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest hypothyroidism and the thyroid function test results confirm it. Amiodarone is known to cause hypothyroidism and can explain the patient's symptoms, while the other options are not associated with hypothyroidism.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of hypothyroidism, which may be caused by medication-induced thyroid dysfunction. Among the options, Amiodarone is known to affect thyroid function, sometimes causing hypothyroidism. Digoxin and Warfarin have no known effect on thyroid function, while Theophylline is more likely to cause hyperthyroidism.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and lab results suggest hypothyroidism. Among the options, only Amiodarone can cause hypothyroidism as a side effect. Digoxin is used to treat arrhythmias and has no effects on thyroid function. Theophylline is a bronchodilator and Warfarin is an anticoagulant, neither of which affects thyroid function.
